volumeInfo.description: This market-leading text provides a comprehensive introduction to probability and statistics for students in engineering and the physical and natural sciences. It is a proven, accurate book with great examples from an outstanding author, Jay Devore. Through the use of lively and realistic examples, students go beyond simply learning about statistics--they actually experience its potential. The book emphasizes concepts, models, methodology and applications, as opposed to rigorous mathematical development and derivations.
volumeInfo.title: Probability and Statistics for Engineering and the Sciences

searchInfo.textSnippet: CD-ROM "includes Java applets (created specifically for this book by Gary McClelland) as well as datasets formatted for MINITAB, SAS, and ASCII."--B. cover.
